message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from French Comm. (Belgium). I need to provide responses to each of the 10 statements using the available response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

I need to roleplay as a teacher and provide reasonable responses that reflect a balanced perspective on AI in education. Let me think through each statement:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally positive and many teachers would agree this is a helpful use case. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also a positive capability. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is a positive application. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs - This is also positive for accessibility. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly beneficial. I'll say "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern/negative statement about potential misuse. I should agree this is a risk. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a legitimate concern about accuracy. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a concern about bias. This is a documented risk. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a concern about privacy. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is a concern about pedagogical appropriateness. 

I'll say "Agree" for this one as well. Now I can prepare the function call with all these responses.
